data.enText: a member of one of the middle ranks in the army and the air force , below an officer
(in Britain) a police officer just below the rank of an inspector
(in the US) a police officer just below the rank of a lieutenant or captain

tr: a lawman with the rank of sergeant
any of several noncommissioned officer ranks in the Army or Air Force or Marines ranking above a corporal
an English barrister of the highest rank

value.def: A sergeant is a non-commissioned officer of middle rank in the army, marines, or air force.

example.ex: A sergeant with a detail of four men came into view.
example.tran: 一名中士和一个四人小分队出现在眼前。

value.tran: (陆军、海军陆战队或空军的)中士

value.def: In the British police force, a sergeant is an officer with the next to lowest rank. In American police forces, a sergeant is an officer with the rank immediately below a captain.

example.ex: ... the unit headed by Sergeant Bell.
example.tran: 由贝尔巡佐带领的分队。

value.tran: (英国警察中的)巡佐;(美国警察中的)警佐，警司

trans: (英国陆军、美国陆军及海军陆战队的)上士
(美国海军陆战队)一级军士长
准尉副官(英国陆军中的团行政助理)
